data.title: Tommy Cooper, Eric Morecambe and Bob Monkhouse tread the boards again
data.meta_description: The Edinburgh Fringe will host the premiere of The Last Laugh, a tribute to the beloved comedians
data.text:
Three comedy greats meet in a theatre dressing room to discuss life and laughs but this is no joke.

Tommy Cooper, Eric Morecambe and Bob Monkhouse are being brought back to life in a play which will make its world premiere at the Edinburgh Fringe in July.

The Last Laugh will feature three actors who have all played the much-missed comedians in separate shows before.

Bringing the characters together in one room is the brainchild of Paul Hendy, an award-winning producer determined to pay homage to three of the biggest names in entertainment.

â€œThey meet as old friends, comedy colleagues and masters of their craft and together they pass the time, discussing the secret of life, death, and what it means to be funny, really
